intro: Ruellia williamsii, commonly known as the Williams' ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, tubular flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 3 feet. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Ruellia williamsii thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shaded areas.
